intro: Lagenocarpus alboniger var. subglabra, commonly known as the smooth-leafed lagenocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
